abstract: Yahoo‘s second-largest shareholder said in an interview Sunday that he would have considered selling to Microsoft for slightly more than the $33 a share the company offered, yet for less than the $37 a share that Yahoo’s board insisted on.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo‘s second-largest shareholder said in an interview Sunday that he would have considered selling to Microsoft for slightly more than the $33 a share the company offered, yet for less than the $37 a share that Yahoo’s board insisted on.

headline.main: A Yahoo Shareholder on What Might Have Been

abstract: “Press reports that major shareholders would have been wiling to take $35 are probably not far off the mark,” said Bill Miller, Yahoo’s second-largest shareholder.
snippet: “Press reports that major shareholders would have been wiling to take $35 are probably not far off the mark,” said Bill Miller, Yahoo’s second-largest shareholder.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Yahoo’s second-largest shareholder said in an interview Sunday that he would have considered selling to Microsoft for slightly more than the $33 a share the company offered, yet for less than the $37 a share that Yahoo’s board insisted on.

headline.main: A Yahoo Shareholder on What Might Have Been
headline.print_headline: A Yahoo Shareholder on What Might Have Been

abstract: As Yahoo investors wait to see how far their shares will fall after Microsoft withdrew its offer, a Google partnership is being considered as a lifeline.
snippet: As Yahoo investors wait to see how far their shares will fall after Microsoft withdrew its offer, a Google partnership is being considered as a lifeline.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  How low will Yahoo’s stock go on Monday? And how long will it stay there?

headline.main: After Deal Dies, Yahoo Weighs Its Next Move

abstract: Without a Yahoo deal, Microsoft faces a problem: its time-tested recipe for success isn’t working against Google.
snippet: Without a Yahoo deal, Microsoft faces a problem: its time-tested recipe for success isn’t working against Google.
lead_paragraph: Steven A. Ballmer, Microsoft’s chief executive, walked away from a Yahoo deal on Saturday still looking for an answer to his company’s fundamental problem: its time-tested recipe for success isn’t working against Google, the leader in the current wave of Internet computing.

headline.main: Microsoft’s Failed Yahoo Bid Risks Online Growth

abstract: Yahoo’s shares closed down 15 percent on the first day of trading after Microsoft’s takeover bid fell through.
snippet: Yahoo’s shares closed down 15 percent on the first day of trading after Microsoft’s takeover bid fell through.
lead_paragraph: After Microsoft withdrew its $33-a-share offer for Yahoo on Saturday, the question was how far Yahoo’s stock would drop. On Monday, the markets gave an initial answer: plenty.

headline.main: Yahoo Stock Plunges After Microsoft Backs Off
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Stock Plunges After Microsoft Backs Off

abstract: The free downloadable software can index all of your Outlook e-mail and make messages quickly and easily searchable.
snippet: The free downloadable software can index all of your Outlook e-mail and make messages quickly and easily searchable.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Adam Smith was 12 when Microsoft introduced its desktop e-mail program, Outlook.

headline.main: If You Use Outlook E-Mail, Meet Xobni
headline.print_headline: If You Use Outlook E-Mail, Meet Xobni

abstract: Shortly after Microsoft announced its hostile bid for Yahoo, Google objected and raised the prospect that it would lobby government regulators to block any merger.
lead_paragraph: Shortly after Microsoft announced its hostile bid for Yahoo, Google objected and raised the prospect that it would lobby government regulators to block any merger.

abstract: While it’s still unclear how Yahoo shareholders will react to management’s decision to spurn Microsoft‘s sweetened $33 per-share bid, Alibaba.com shareholders have already made their feelings clear.
lead_paragraph: While it’s still unclear how Yahoo shareholders will react to management’s decision to spurn Microsoft‘s sweetened $33 per-share bid, Alibaba.com shareholders have already made their feelings clear.

headline.main: Alibaba Takes A Dive After Microsoft Pulls Yahoo Bid

abstract: Steven A. Ballmer, Microsoft‘s chief executive, walked away from a Yahoo deal on Saturday still looking for an answer to his company’s fundamental problem: its time-tested recipe for success isn’t working against Google, the leader in the current wave of Internet computing.
lead_paragraph: Steven A. Ballmer, Microsoft‘s chief executive, walked away from a Yahoo deal on Saturday still looking for an answer to his company’s fundamental problem: its time-tested recipe for success isn’t working against Google, the leader in the current wave of Internet computing.

abstract: Yahoo’s shares fell by 20 percent when they opened for trading Monday morning. The merger speculators bailed out, but the question remains who would want to buy the company shares after what they saw of its management over the last three months?
snippet: Yahoo’s shares fell by 20 percent when they opened for trading Monday morning. The merger speculators bailed out, but the question remains who would want to buy the company shares after what they saw of its management over the last three months?
lead_paragraph: At least in the short term, many Yahoo shareholders are regretting that they didn’t sell their stock last week, when it looked like discussions with Microsoft might result in a buyout.

headline.main: Who Is Buying Yahoo Shares Today?

abstract: Some of Jerry Yang’s top lieutenants at Yahoo reportedly cheered on Saturday when Microsoft pulled its unsolicited bid for the company. But Mr. Yang’s net worth is taking a hit as a result: The market value of his 3.9 percent Yahoo stake plunged by more than $300 million Monday morning, as much of the premium in Yahoo’s stock evaporated.
lead_paragraph: Some of Jerry Yang’s top lieutenants at Yahoo reportedly cheered on Saturday when Microsoft pulled its unsolicited bid for the company. But Mr. Yang’s net worth is taking a hit as a result: The market value of his 3.9 percent Yahoo stake plunged by more than $300 million Monday morning, as much of the premium in Yahoo’s stock evaporated.

headline.main: Yahoo Stock Falls 20% in Early Trading

abstract: Now that Microsoft has abandoned its pursuit of Yahoo, both of those companies are now considering other acquisitions. Likely targets include AOL, which has a big position in online display advertising, and Facebook, which has a huge and growing audience.
snippet: Now that Microsoft has abandoned its pursuit of Yahoo, both of those companies are now considering other acquisitions. Likely targets include AOL, which has a big position in online display advertising, and Facebook, which has a huge and growing a...
lead_paragraph: Yahoo’s stock price may be falling like a rock, but the value of dozens of other Web companies—private ones like Facebook and divisions of public companies like Time Warner’s AOL—is surging.

headline.main: Now in Play: AOL, Facebook and Many Others
